FRONT PAGE

An article on Wednesday about the equestrian coach Jimmy A. Williams referred incorrectly to the period during which Alan F. Balch was president of the Flintridge Riding Club.

BUSINESS DAY

An article on Thursday about SCL Group, the parent company of Cambridge Analytica, described incorrectly a project that SCL Group conducted in Libya.

SPECIAL SECTION: VISIONARIES

An article on Sunday about leading environmentalists misstated where Kendra Kuhl was an undergraduate chemistry major.
Errors are corrected during the press run whenever possible, so some errors noted here may not have appeared in all editions.
It was the University of Montana, not Stanford University; she earned her doctorate in chemistry at Stanford.
It was conducted after Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi was in power, not during his time in power.
He was president in the 1980s and 1990s, not the 1970s.
